speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: it he is to sojourn with you? How creeps

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: acquaintance?

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: His father and I were soldiers together; to whom I

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: have been often bound for no less than my life.

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: Here comes the Briton: let him be so entertained

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: amongst you as suits, with gentlemen of your

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: knowing, to a stranger of his quality.

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: Enter POSTHUMUS LEONATUS

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: I beseech you all, be better known to this

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: gentleman; whom I commend to you as a noble friend

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: of mine: how worthy he is I will leave to appear

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: hereafter, rather than story him in his own hearing.

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: Sir, we have known together in Orleans.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Since when I have been debtor to you for courtesies,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: which I will be ever to pay and yet pay still.

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: Sir, you o'er-rate my poor kindness: I was glad I

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: did atone my countryman and you; it had been pity

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: you should have been put together with so mortal a

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: purpose as then each bore, upon importance of so

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: slight and trivial a nature.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: By your pardon, sir, I was then a young traveller;

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: rather shunned to go even with what I heard than in

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: my every action to be guided by others' experiences:

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: but upon my mended judgment--if I offend not to say

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: it is mended--my quarrel was not altogether slight.

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: 'Faith, yes, to be put to the arbitrement of swords,

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: and by such two that would by all likelihood have

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: confounded one the other, or have fallen both.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Can we, with manners, ask what was the difference?

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: Safely, I think: 'twas a contention in public,

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: which may, without contradiction, suffer the report.

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: It was much like an argument that fell out last

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: night, where each of us fell in praise of our

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: country mistresses; this gentleman at that time

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: vouching--and upon warrant of bloody

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: affirmation--his to be more fair, virtuous, wise,

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: chaste, constant-qualified and less attemptable

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: than any the rarest of our ladies in France.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: That lady is not now living, or this gentleman's

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: opinion by this worn out.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: She holds her virtue still and I my mind.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: You must not so far prefer her 'fore ours of Italy.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Being so far provoked as I was in France, I would

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: abate her nothing, though I profess myself her

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: adorer, not her friend.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: As fair and as good--a kind of hand-in-hand

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: comparison--had been something too fair and too good

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: for any lady in Britain. If she went before others

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: I have seen, as that diamond of yours outlustres

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: many I have beheld. I could not but believe she

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: excelled many: but I have not seen the most

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: precious diamond that is, nor you the lady.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: I praised her as I rated her: so do I my stone.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: What do you esteem it at?

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: More than the world enjoys.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Either your unparagoned mistress is dead, or she's

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: outprized by a trifle.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: You are mistaken: the one may be sold, or given, if

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: there were wealth enough for the purchase, or merit

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: for the gift: the other is not a thing for sale,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: and only the gift of the gods.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Which the gods have given you?

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Which, by their graces, I will keep.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: You may wear her in title yours: but, you know,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: strange fowl light upon neighbouring ponds. Your

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: ring may be stolen too: so your brace of unprizable

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: estimations; the one is but frail and the other

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: casual; a cunning thief, or a that way accomplished

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: courtier, would hazard the winning both of first and last.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Your Italy contains none so accomplished a courtier

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: to convince the honour of my mistress, if, in the

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: holding or loss of that, you term her frail. I do

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: nothing doubt you have store of thieves;

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: notwithstanding, I fear not my ring.

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: Let us leave here, gentlemen.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Sir, with all my heart. This worthy signior, I

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: thank him, makes no stranger of me; we are familiar at first.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: With five times so much conversation, I should get

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: ground of your fair mistress, make her go back, even

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: to the yielding, had I admittance and opportunity to friend.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: No, no.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: I dare thereupon pawn the moiety of my estate to

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: your ring; which, in my opinion, o'ervalues it

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: something: but I make my wager rather against your

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: confidence than her reputation: and, to bar your

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: offence herein too, I durst attempt it against any

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: lady in the world.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: You are a great deal abused in too bold a

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: persuasion; and I doubt not you sustain what you're

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: worthy of by your attempt.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: What's that?

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: A repulse: though your attempt, as you call it,

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: deserve more; a punishment too.

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: Gentlemen, enough of this: it came in too suddenly;

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: let it die as it was born, and, I pray you, be

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: better acquainted.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Would I had put my estate and my neighbour's on the

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: approbation of what I have spoke!

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: What lady would you choose to assail?

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Yours; whom in constancy you think stands so safe.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: I will lay you ten thousand ducats to your ring,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: that, commend me to the court where your lady is,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: with no more advantage than the opportunity of a

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: second conference, and I will bring from thence

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: that honour of hers which you imagine so reserved.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: I will wage against your gold, gold to it: my ring

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: I hold dear as my finger; 'tis part of it.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: You are afraid, and therein the wiser. If you buy

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: ladies' flesh at a million a dram, you cannot

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: preserve it from tainting: but I see you have some

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: religion in you, that you fear.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: This is but a custom in your tongue; you bear a

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: graver purpose, I hope.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: I am the master of my speeches, and would undergo

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: what's spoken, I swear.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Will you? I shall but lend my diamond till your

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: return: let there be covenants drawn between's: my

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: mistress exceeds in goodness the hugeness of your

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: unworthy thinking: I dare you to this match: here's my ring.

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: I will have it no lay.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: By the gods, it is one. If I bring you no

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: sufficient testimony that I have enjoyed the dearest

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: bodily part of your mistress, my ten thousand ducats

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: are yours; so is your diamond too: if I come off,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: and leave her in such honour as you have trust in,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: she your jewel, this your jewel, and my gold are

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: yours: provided I have your commendation for my more

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: free entertainment.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: I embrace these conditions; let us have articles

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: betwixt us. Only, thus far you shall answer: if

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: you make your voyage upon her and give me directly

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: to understand you have prevailed, I am no further

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: your enemy; she is not worth our debate: if she

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: remain unseduced, you not making it appear

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: otherwise, for your ill opinion and the assault you

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: have made to her chastity you shall answer me with

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: your sword.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Your hand; a covenant: we will have these things set

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: down by lawful counsel, and straight away for

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Britain, lest the bargain should catch cold and

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: starve: I will fetch my gold and have our two

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: wagers recorded.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Agreed.

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Exeunt POSTHUMUS LEONATUS and IACHIMO

speaker: Frenchman
text_entry: Will this hold, think you?

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: Signior Iachimo will not from it.

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: Pray, let us follow 'em.

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: SCENE V. Britain. A room in Cymbeline's palace.

speaker: PHILARIO
text_entry: Enter QUEEN, Ladies, and CORNELIUS

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Whiles yet the dew's on ground, gather those flowers;

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Make haste: who has the note of them?

speaker: First Lady
text_entry: I, madam.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Dispatch.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Exeunt Ladies

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Now, master doctor, have you brought those drugs?

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Pleaseth your highness, ay: here they are, madam:

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Presenting a small box

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: But I beseech your grace, without offence,--

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: My conscience bids me ask--wherefore you have

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Commanded of me those most poisonous compounds,

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Which are the movers of a languishing death;

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: But though slow, deadly?

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: I wonder, doctor,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Thou ask'st me such a question. Have I not been

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Thy pupil long? Hast thou not learn'd me how

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: To make perfumes? distil? preserve? yea, so

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: That our great king himself doth woo me oft

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: For my confections? Having thus far proceeded,--

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Unless thou think'st me devilish--is't not meet

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: That I did amplify my judgment in

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Other conclusions? I will try the forces

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Of these thy compounds on such creatures as

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: We count not worth the hanging, but none human,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: To try the vigour of them and apply

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Allayments to their act, and by them gather

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Their several virtues and effects.

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Your highness

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Shall from this practise but make hard your heart:

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Besides, the seeing these effects will be

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Both noisome and infectious.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: O, content thee.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Enter PISANIO

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Aside

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Here comes a flattering rascal; upon him

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Will I first work: he's for his master,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: An enemy to my son. How now, Pisanio!

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Doctor, your service for this time is ended;

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Take your own way.

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: [Aside]          I do suspect you, madam;

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: But you shall do no harm.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: [To PISANIO]            Hark thee, a word.

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: [Aside]  I do not like her. She doth think she has

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Strange lingering poisons: I do know her spirit,

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: And will not trust one of her malice with

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: A drug of such damn'd nature. Those she has

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Will stupefy and dull the sense awhile;

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Which first, perchance, she'll prove on

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: cats and dogs,

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Then afterward up higher: but there is

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: No danger in what show of death it makes,

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: More than the locking-up the spirits a time,

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: To be more fresh, reviving. She is fool'd

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: With a most false effect; and I the truer,

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: So to be false with her.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: No further service, doctor,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Until I send for thee.

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: I humbly take my leave.

speaker: CORNELIUS
text_entry: Exit

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Weeps she still, say'st thou? Dost thou think in time

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: She will not quench and let instructions enter

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Where folly now possesses? Do thou work:

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: When thou shalt bring me word she loves my son,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: I'll tell thee on the instant thou art then

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: As great as is thy master, greater, for

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: His fortunes all lie speechless and his name

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Is at last gasp: return he cannot, nor

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Continue where he is: to shift his being

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Is to exchange one misery with another,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: And every day that comes comes to decay

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: A day's work in him. What shalt thou expect,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: To be depender on a thing that leans,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Who cannot be new built, nor has no friends,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: So much as but to prop him?

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: The QUEEN drops the box: PISANIO takes it up

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Thou takest up

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Thou know'st not what; but take it for thy labour:

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: It is a thing I made, which hath the king

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Five times redeem'd from death: I do not know

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: What is more cordial. Nay, I prethee, take it;

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: It is an earnest of a further good

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: That I mean to thee. Tell thy mistress how

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: The case stands with her; do't as from thyself.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Think what a chance thou changest on, but think

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Thou hast thy mistress still, to boot, my son,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Who shall take notice of thee: I'll move the king

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: To any shape of thy preferment such

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: As thou'lt desire; and then myself, I chiefly,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: That set thee on to this desert, am bound

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: To load thy merit richly. Call my women:

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Think on my words.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Exit PISANIO

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: A sly and constant knave,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Not to be shaked; the agent for his master

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: And the remembrancer of her to hold

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: The hand-fast to her lord. I have given him that

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Which, if he take, shall quite unpeople her

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Of liegers for her sweet, and which she after,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Except she bend her humour, shall be assured

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: To taste of too.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Re-enter PISANIO and Ladies

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: So, so: well done, well done:

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: The violets, cowslips, and the primroses,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Bear to my closet. Fare thee well, Pisanio;

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Think on my words.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Exeunt QUEEN and Ladies

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: And shall do:

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: But when to my good lord I prove untrue,

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: I'll choke myself: there's all I'll do for you.

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: SCENE VI. The same. Another room in the palace.

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Enter IMOGEN

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: A father cruel, and a step-dame false;

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: A foolish suitor to a wedded lady,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: That hath her husband banish'd;--O, that husband!

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: My supreme crown of grief! and those repeated

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Vexations of it! Had I been thief-stol'n,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: As my two brothers, happy! but most miserable

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Is the desire that's glorious: blest be those,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: How mean soe'er, that have their honest wills,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Which seasons comfort. Who may this be? Fie!

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Enter PISANIO and IACHIMO

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Madam, a noble gentleman of Rome,

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Comes from my lord with letters.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Change you, madam?

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: The worthy Leonatus is in safety

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: And greets your highness dearly.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Presents a letter

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Thanks, good sir:

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: You're kindly welcome.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: [Aside]  All of her that is out of door most rich!

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: If she be furnish'd with a mind so rare,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: She is alone the Arabian bird, and I

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Have lost the wager. Boldness be my friend!

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Arm me, audacity, from head to foot!

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Or, like the Parthian, I shall flying fight;

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Rather directly fly.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: [Reads]  'He is one of the noblest note, to whose

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: kindnesses I am most infinitely tied. Reflect upon

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: him accordingly, as you value your trust--

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: LEONATUS.'

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: So far I read aloud:

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: But even the very middle of my heart

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Is warm'd by the rest, and takes it thankfully.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: You are as welcome, worthy sir, as I

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Have words to bid you, and shall find it so

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: In all that I can do.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Thanks, fairest lady.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: What, are men mad? Hath nature given them eyes

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: To see this vaulted arch, and the rich crop

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Of sea and land, which can distinguish 'twixt

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: The fiery orbs above and the twinn'd stones

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Upon the number'd beach? and can we not

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Partition make with spectacles so precious

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: 'Twixt fair and foul?

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: What makes your admiration?

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: It cannot be i' the eye, for apes and monkeys

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: 'Twixt two such shes would chatter this way and

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Contemn with mows the other; nor i' the judgment,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: For idiots in this case of favour would

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Be wisely definite; nor i' the appetite;

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Sluttery to such neat excellence opposed

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Should make desire vomit emptiness,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Not so allured to feed.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: What is the matter, trow?

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: The cloyed will,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: That satiate yet unsatisfied desire, that tub

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Both fill'd and running, ravening first the lamb

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Longs after for the garbage.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: What, dear sir,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Thus raps you? Are you well?

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Thanks, madam; well.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: To PISANIO

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Beseech you, sir, desire

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: My man's abode where I did leave him: he

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Is strange and peevish.

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: I was going, sir,

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: To give him welcome.

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Continues well my lord? His health, beseech you?

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Well, madam.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Is he disposed to mirth? I hope he is.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Exceeding pleasant; none a stranger there

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: So merry and so gamesome: he is call'd

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: The Briton reveller.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: When he was here,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: He did incline to sadness, and oft-times

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Not knowing why.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: I never saw him sad.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: There is a Frenchman his companion, one

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: An eminent monsieur, that, it seems, much loves

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: A Gallian girl at home; he furnaces

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: The thick sighs from him, whiles the jolly Briton--

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Your lord, I mean--laughs from's free lungs, cries 'O,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Can my sides hold, to think that man, who knows

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: By history, report, or his own proof,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: What woman is, yea, what she cannot choose

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: But must be, will his free hours languish for

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Assured bondage?'

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Will my lord say so?

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Ay, madam, with his eyes in flood with laughter:

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: It is a recreation to be by

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: And hear him mock the Frenchman. But, heavens know,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Some men are much to blame.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Not he, I hope.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Not he: but yet heaven's bounty towards him might

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Be used more thankfully. In himself, 'tis much;

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: In you, which I account his beyond all talents,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Whilst I am bound to wonder, I am bound

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: To pity too.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: What do you pity, sir?

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Two creatures heartily.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Am I one, sir?

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: You look on me: what wreck discern you in me

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Deserves your pity?

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Lamentable! What,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: To hide me from the radiant sun and solace

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: I' the dungeon by a snuff?

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I pray you, sir,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Deliver with more openness your answers

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: To my demands. Why do you pity me?

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: That others do--

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: I was about to say--enjoy your--But

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: It is an office of the gods to venge it,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Not mine to speak on 't.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: You do seem to know

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Something of me, or what concerns me: pray you,--

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Since doubling things go ill often hurts more

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Than to be sure they do; for certainties

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Either are past remedies, or, timely knowing,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: The remedy then born--discover to me

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: What both you spur and stop.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Had I this cheek

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: To bathe my lips upon; this hand, whose touch,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Whose every touch, would force the feeler's soul

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: To the oath of loyalty; this object, which

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Takes prisoner the wild motion of mine eye,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Fixing it only here; should I, damn'd then,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Slaver with lips as common as the stairs

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: That mount the Capitol; join gripes with hands

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Made hard with hourly falsehood--falsehood, as

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: With labour; then by-peeping in an eye

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Base and unlustrous as the smoky light

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: That's fed with stinking tallow; it were fit

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: That all the plagues of hell should at one time

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Encounter such revolt.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: My lord, I fear,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Has forgot Britain.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: And himself. Not I,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Inclined to this intelligence, pronounce

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: The beggary of his change; but 'tis your graces

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: That from pay mutest conscience to my tongue

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Charms this report out.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Let me hear no more.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: O dearest soul! your cause doth strike my heart

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: With pity, that doth make me sick. A lady

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: So fair, and fasten'd to an empery,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Would make the great'st king double,--to be partner'd

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: With tomboys hired with that self-exhibition

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Which your own coffers yield! with diseased ventures

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: That play with all infirmities for gold

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Which rottenness can lend nature! such boil'd stuff

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: As well might poison poison! Be revenged;

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Or she that bore you was no queen, and you

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Recoil from your great stock.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Revenged!

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: How should I be revenged? If this be true,--

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: As I have such a heart that both mine ears

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Must not in haste abuse--if it be true,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: How should I be revenged?

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Should he make me

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Live, like Diana's priest, betwixt cold sheets,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Whiles he is vaulting variable ramps,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: In your despite, upon your purse? Revenge it.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: I dedicate myself to your sweet pleasure,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: More noble than that runagate to your bed,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: And will continue fast to your affection,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Still close as sure.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: What, ho, Pisanio!

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Let me my service tender on your lips.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Away! I do condemn mine ears that have

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: So long attended thee. If thou wert honourable,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Thou wouldst have told this tale for virtue, not

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: For such an end thou seek'st,--as base as strange.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Thou wrong'st a gentleman, who is as far

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: From thy report as thou from honour, and

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Solicit'st here a lady that disdains

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Thee and the devil alike. What ho, Pisanio!

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: The king my father shall be made acquainted

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Of thy assault: if he shall think it fit,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: A saucy stranger in his court to mart

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: As in a Romish stew and to expound

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: His beastly mind to us, he hath a court

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: He little cares for and a daughter who

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: He not respects at all. What, ho, Pisanio!

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: O happy Leonatus! I may say

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: The credit that thy lady hath of thee

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Deserves thy trust, and thy most perfect goodness

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Her assured credit. Blessed live you long!

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: A lady to the worthiest sir that ever

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Country call'd his! and you his mistress, only

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: For the most worthiest fit! Give me your pardon.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: I have spoke this, to know if your affiance

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Were deeply rooted; and shall make your lord,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: That which he is, new o'er: and he is one

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: The truest manner'd; such a holy witch

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: That he enchants societies into him;

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Half all men's hearts are his.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: You make amends.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: He sits 'mongst men like a descended god:

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: He hath a kind of honour sets him off,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: More than a mortal seeming. Be not angry,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Most mighty princess, that I have adventured

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: To try your taking a false report; which hath

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Honour'd with confirmation your great judgment

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: In the election of a sir so rare,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Which you know cannot err: the love I bear him

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Made me to fan you thus, but the gods made you,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Unlike all others, chaffless. Pray, your pardon.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: All's well, sir: take my power i' the court

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: for yours.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: My humble thanks. I had almost forgot

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: To entreat your grace but in a small request,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: And yet of moment to, for it concerns

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Your lord; myself and other noble friends,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Are partners in the business.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Pray, what is't?

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Some dozen Romans of us and your lord--

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: The best feather of our wing--have mingled sums

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: To buy a present for the emperor

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Which I, the factor for the rest, have done

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: In France: 'tis plate of rare device, and jewels

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Of rich and exquisite form; their values great;

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: And I am something curious, being strange,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: To have them in safe stowage: may it please you

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: To take them in protection?

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Willingly;

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: And pawn mine honour for their safety: since

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: My lord hath interest in them, I will keep them

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: In my bedchamber.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: They are in a trunk,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Attended by my men: I will make bold

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: To send them to you, only for this night;

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: I must aboard to-morrow.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: O, no, no.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Yes, I beseech; or I shall short my word

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: By lengthening my return. From Gallia

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: I cross'd the seas on purpose and on promise

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: To see your grace.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I thank you for your pains:

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: But not away to-morrow!

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: O, I must, madam:

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Therefore I shall beseech you, if you please

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: To greet your lord with writing, do't to-night:

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: I have outstood my time; which is material

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: To the tender of our present.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I will write.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Send your trunk to me; it shall safe be kept,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: And truly yielded you. You're very welcome.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: ACT II

text_entry: SCENE I. Britain. Before Cymbeline's palace.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Enter CLOTEN and two Lords

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Was there ever man had such luck! when I kissed the

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: jack, upon an up-cast to be hit away! I had a

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: hundred pound on't: and then a whoreson jackanapes

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: must take me up for swearing; as if I borrowed mine

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: oaths of him and might not spend them at my pleasure.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: What got he by that? You have broke his pate with

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: your bowl.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: [Aside]  If his wit had been like him that broke it,

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: it would have run all out.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: When a gentleman is disposed to swear, it is not for

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: any standers-by to curtail his oaths, ha?

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: No my lord;

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: Aside

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: nor crop the ears of them.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Whoreson dog! I give him satisfaction?

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Would he had been one of my rank!

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: [Aside]  To have smelt like a fool.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: I am not vexed more at any thing in the earth: a

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: pox on't! I had rather not be so noble as I am;

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: they dare not fight with me, because of the queen my

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: mother: every Jack-slave hath his bellyful of

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: fighting, and I must go up and down like a cock that

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: nobody can match.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: [Aside]  You are cock and capon too; and you crow,

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: cock, with your comb on.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Sayest thou?

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: It is not fit your lordship should undertake every

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: companion that you give offence to.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: No, I know that: but it is fit I should commit

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: offence to my inferiors.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: Ay, it is fit for your lordship only.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Why, so I say.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Did you hear of a stranger that's come to court to-night?

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: A stranger, and I not know on't!

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: [Aside]  He's a strange fellow himself, and knows it

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: not.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: There's an Italian come; and, 'tis thought, one of

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Leonatus' friends.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Leonatus! a banished rascal; and he's another,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: whatsoever he be. Who told you of this stranger?

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: One of your lordship's pages.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Is it fit I went to look upon him? is there no

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: derogation in't?

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: You cannot derogate, my lord.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Not easily, I think.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: [Aside]  You are a fool granted; therefore your

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: issues, being foolish, do not derogate.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Come, I'll go see this Italian: what I have lost

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: to-day at bowls I'll win to-night of him. Come, go.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: I'll attend your lordship.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: Exeunt CLOTEN and First Lord

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: That such a crafty devil as is his mother

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: Should yield the world this ass! a woman that

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: Bears all down with her brain; and this her son

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: Cannot take two from twenty, for his heart,

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: And leave eighteen. Alas, poor princess,

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: Thou divine Imogen, what thou endurest,

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: Betwixt a father by thy step-dame govern'd,

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: A mother hourly coining plots, a wooer

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: More hateful than the foul expulsion is

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: Of thy dear husband, than that horrid act

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: Of the divorce he'ld make! The heavens hold firm

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: The walls of thy dear honour, keep unshaked

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: That temple, thy fair mind, that thou mayst stand,

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: To enjoy thy banish'd lord and this great land!

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: Exit

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: SCENE II. Imogen's bedchamber in Cymbeline's palace:

speaker: Second Lord

text_entry: Who's there? my woman Helen?

speaker: Lady
text_entry: Please you, madam

text_entry: What hour is it?

speaker: Lady
text_entry: Almost midnight, madam.

text_entry: I have read three hours then: mine eyes are weak:

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Fold down the leaf where I have left: to bed:

text_entry: Take not away the taper, leave it burning;

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: And if thou canst awake by four o' the clock,

text_entry: I prithee, call me. Sleep hath seized me wholly

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: To your protection I commend me, gods.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: From fairies and the tempters of the night

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Guard me, beseech ye.

text_entry: Sleeps. IACHIMO comes from the trunk

text_entry: The crickets sing, and man's o'er-labour'd sense

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: The chastity he wounded. Cytherea,

text_entry: How bravely thou becomest thy bed, fresh lily,

text_entry: And whiter than the sheets! That I might touch!

text_entry: But kiss; one kiss! Rubies unparagon'd,

text_entry: Perfumes the chamber thus: the flame o' the taper

text_entry: To see the enclosed lights, now canopied

text_entry: Under these windows, white and azure laced

text_entry: With blue of heaven's own tinct. But my design,

text_entry: To note the chamber: I will write all down:

text_entry: The adornment of her bed; the arras; figures,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Why, such and such; and the contents o' the story.

text_entry: Ah, but some natural notes about her body,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Above ten thousand meaner moveables

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Would testify, to enrich mine inventory.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: O sleep, thou ape of death, lie dull upon her!

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: And be her sense but as a monument,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Thus in a chapel lying! Come off, come off:

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Taking off her bracelet

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: As slippery as the Gordian knot was hard!

text_entry: 'Tis mine; and this will witness outwardly,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: As strongly as the conscience does within,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: To the madding of her lord. On her left breast

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: A mole cinque-spotted, like the crimson drops

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: I' the bottom of a cowslip: here's a voucher,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Stronger than ever law could make: this secret

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Will force him think I have pick'd the lock and ta'en

text_entry: The treasure of her honour. No more. To what end?

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Why should I write this down, that's riveted,

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Where Philomel gave up. I have enough:

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: To the trunk again, and shut the spring of it.

speaker: IACHIMO
text_entry: Swift, swift, you dragons of the night, that dawning

Enter CLOTEN and Lords

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Your lordship is the most patient man in loss, the

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: most coldest that ever turned up ace.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: It would make any man cold to lose.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: But not every man patient after the noble temper of

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: your lordship. You are most hot and furious when you win.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Winning will put any man into courage. If I could

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: get this foolish Imogen, I should have gold enough.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: It's almost morning, is't not?

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Day, my lord.

text_entry: I would this music would come: I am advised to give

text_entry: her music o' mornings; they say it will penetrate.

text_entry: fingering, so; we'll try with tongue too: if none

text_entry: will do, let her remain; but I'll never give o'er.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: First, a very excellent good-conceited thing;

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: after, a wonderful sweet air, with admirable rich

text_entry: words to it: and then let her consider.

text_entry: SONG

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Hark, hark! the lark at heaven's gate sings,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: And Phoebus 'gins arise,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: His steeds to water at those springs

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: On chaliced flowers that lies;

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: And winking Mary-buds begin

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: To ope their golden eyes:

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: With every thing that pretty is,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: My lady sweet, arise:

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Arise, arise.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: So, get you gone. If this penetrate, I will

text_entry: consider your music the better: if it do not, it is

text_entry: calves'-guts, nor the voice of unpaved eunuch to

speaker: PHILARIO

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: The woman's; flattering, hers; deceiving, hers;

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS
text_entry: Lust and rank thoughts, hers, hers; revenges, hers;

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS

speaker: POSTHUMUS LEONATUS

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: You must know,

speaker: CYMBELINE

text_entry: This tribute from us, we were free:

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Caesar's ambition,

text_entry: The sides o' the world, against all colour here

text_entry: I am sorry, Cymbeline,

text_entry: Forbear sharp speeches to her: she's a lady

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: So tender of rebukes that words are strokes

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: And strokes death to her.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Re-enter Attendant

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Where is she, sir? How

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Can her contempt be answer'd?

speaker: Attendant
text_entry: Please you, sir,

speaker: Attendant
text_entry: Her chambers are all lock'd; and there's no answer

speaker: Attendant
text_entry: That will be given to the loudest noise we make.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: My lord, when last I went to visit her,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: She pray'd me to excuse her keeping close,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Whereto constrain'd by her infirmity,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: She should that duty leave unpaid to you,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Which daily she was bound to proffer: this

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: She wish'd me to make known; but our great court

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Made me to blame in memory.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Her doors lock'd?

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Not seen of late? Grant, heavens, that which I fear

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Prove false!

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Exit

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Son, I say, follow the king.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: That man of hers, Pisanio, her old servant,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: have not seen these two days.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Go, look after.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Exit CLOTEN

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Pisanio, thou that stand'st so for Posthumus!

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: He hath a drug of mine; I pray his absence

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Proceed by swallowing that, for he believes

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: It is a thing most precious. But for her,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Where is she gone? Haply, despair hath seized her,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Or, wing'd with fervor of her love, she's flown

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: To her desired Posthumus: gone she is

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: To death or to dishonour; and my end

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Can make good use of either: she being down,

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: I have the placing of the British crown.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Re-enter CLOTEN

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: How now, my son!

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: 'Tis certain she is fled.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Go in and cheer the king: he rages; none

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Dare come about him.

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: [Aside]            All the better: may

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: This night forestall him of the coming day!

speaker: QUEEN
text_entry: Exit

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: I love and hate her: for she's fair and royal,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: And that she hath all courtly parts more exquisite

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Than lady, ladies, woman; from every one

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: The best she hath, and she, of all compounded,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Outsells them all; I love her therefore: but

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Disdaining me and throwing favours on

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: The low Posthumus slanders so her judgment

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: That what's else rare is choked; and in that point

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: I will conclude to hate her, nay, indeed,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: To be revenged upon her. For when fools Shall--

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Enter PISANIO

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Who is here? What, are you packing, sirrah?

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Come hither: ah, you precious pander! Villain,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Where is thy lady? In a word; or else

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Thou art straightway with the fiends.

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: O, good my lord!

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Where is thy lady? Or, by Jupiter,--

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: I will not ask again. Close villain,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: I'll have this secret from thy heart, or rip

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Thy heart to find it. Is she with Posthumus?

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: From whose so many weights of baseness cannot

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: A dram of worth be drawn.

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Alas, my lord,

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: How can she be with him? When was she missed?

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: He is in Rome.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Where is she, sir? Come nearer;

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: No further halting: satisfy me home

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: What is become of her.

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: O, my all-worthy lord!

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: All-worthy villain!

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Discover where thy mistress is at once,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: At the next word: no more of 'worthy lord!'

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Speak, or thy silence on the instant is

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Thy condemnation and thy death.

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Then, sir,

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: This paper is the history of my knowledge

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Touching her flight.

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Presenting a letter

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Let's see't. I will pursue her

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Even to Augustus' throne.

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: [Aside]                 Or this, or perish.

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: She's far enough; and what he learns by this

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: May prove his travel, not her danger.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Hum!

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: [Aside]  I'll write to my lord she's dead. O Imogen,

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Safe mayst thou wander, safe return again!

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Sirrah, is this letter true?

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Sir, as I think.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: It is Posthumus' hand; I know't. Sirrah, if thou

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: wouldst not be a villain, but do me true service,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: undergo those employments wherein I should have

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: cause to use thee with a serious industry, that is,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: what villany soe'er I bid thee do, to perform it

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: directly and truly, I would think thee an honest

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: man: thou shouldst neither want my means for thy

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: relief nor my voice for thy preferment.

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Well, my good lord.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Wilt thou serve me? for since patiently and

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: constantly thou hast stuck to the bare fortune of

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: that beggar Posthumus, thou canst not, in the

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: course of gratitude, but be a diligent follower of

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: mine: wilt thou serve me?

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Sir, I will.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Give me thy hand; here's my purse. Hast any of thy

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: late master's garments in thy possession?

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: I have, my lord, at my lodging, the same suit he

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: wore when he took leave of my lady and mistress.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: The first service thou dost me, fetch that suit

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: hither: let it be thy lint service; go.

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: I shall, my lord.

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Meet thee at Milford-Haven!--I forgot to ask him one

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: thing; I'll remember't anon:--even there, thou

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: villain Posthumus, will I kill thee. I would these

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: garments were come. She said upon a time--the

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: bitterness of it I now belch from my heart--that she

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: held the very garment of Posthumus in more respect

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: than my noble and natural person together with the

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: adornment of my qualities. With that suit upon my

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: back, will I ravish her: first kill him, and in her

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: eyes; there shall she see my valour, which will then

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: be a torment to her contempt. He on the ground, my

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: speech of insultment ended on his dead body, and

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: when my lust hath dined,--which, as I say, to vex

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: her I will execute in the clothes that she so

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: praised,--to the court I'll knock her back, foot

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: her home again. She hath despised me rejoicingly,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: and I'll be merry in my revenge.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Re-enter PISANIO, with the clothes

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Be those the garments?

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Ay, my noble lord.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: How long is't since she went to Milford-Haven?

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: She can scarce be there yet.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Bring this apparel to my chamber; that is the second

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: thing that I have commanded thee: the third is,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: that thou wilt be a voluntary mute to my design. Be

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: but duteous, and true preferment shall tender itself

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: to thee. My revenge is now at Milford: would I had

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: wings to follow it! Come, and be true.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Exit

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Thou bid'st me to my loss: for true to thee

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Were to prove false, which I will never be,

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: To him that is most true. To Milford go,

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: And find not her whom thou pursuest. Flow, flow,

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: You heavenly blessings, on her! This fool's speed

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Be cross'd with slowness; labour be his meed!

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: SCENE VI. Wales. Before the cave of Belarius.

speaker: PISANIO
text_entry: Enter IMOGEN, in boy's clothes

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I see a man's life is a tedious one:

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I have tired myself, and for two nights together

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Have made the ground my bed. I should be sick,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: But that my resolution helps me. Milford,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: When from the mountain-top Pisanio show'd thee,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Thou wast within a ken: O Jove! I think

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Foundations fly the wretched; such, I mean,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Where they should be relieved. Two beggars told me

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I could not miss my way: will poor folks lie,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: That have afflictions on them, knowing 'tis

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: A punishment or trial? Yes; no wonder,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: When rich ones scarce tell true. To lapse in fulness

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Is sorer than to lie for need, and falsehood

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Is worse in kings than beggars. My dear lord!

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Thou art one o' the false ones. Now I think on thee,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: My hunger's gone; but even before, I was

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: At point to sink for food. But what is this?

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Here is a path to't: 'tis some savage hold:

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I were best not to call; I dare not call:

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: yet famine,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Ere clean it o'erthrow nature, makes it valiant,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Plenty and peace breeds cowards: hardness ever

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Of hardiness is mother. Ho! who's here?

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: If any thing that's civil, speak; if savage,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Take or lend. Ho! No answer? Then I'll enter.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Best draw my sword: and if mine enemy

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: But fear the sword like me, he'll scarcely look on't.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Such a foe, good heavens!

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Exit, to the cave

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Enter BELARIUS, GUIDERIUS, and ARVIRAGUS

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: You, Polydote, have proved best woodman and

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Are master of the feast: Cadwal and I

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Will play the cook and servant; 'tis our match:

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: The sweat of industry would dry and die,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: But for the end it works to. Come; our stomachs

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Will make what's homely savoury: weariness

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Can snore upon the flint, when resty sloth

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Finds the down pillow hard. Now peace be here,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Poor house, that keep'st thyself!

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: I am thoroughly weary.

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: I am weak with toil, yet strong in appetite.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: There is cold meat i' the cave; we'll browse on that,

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Whilst what we have kill'd be cook'd.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: [Looking into the cave]

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Stay; come not in.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: But that it eats our victuals, I should think

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Here were a fairy.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: What's the matter, sir?

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: By Jupiter, an angel! or, if not,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: An earthly paragon! Behold divineness

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: No elder than a boy!

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Re-enter IMOGEN

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Good masters, harm me not:

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Before I enter'd here, I call'd; and thought

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: To have begg'd or bought what I have took:

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: good troth,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I have stol'n nought, nor would not, though I had found

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Gold strew'd i' the floor. Here's money for my meat:

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I would have left it on the board so soon

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: As I had made my meal, and parted

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: With prayers for the provider.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Money, youth?

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: All gold and silver rather turn to dirt!

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: As 'tis no better reckon'd, but of those

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Who worship dirty gods.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I see you're angry:

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Know, if you kill me for my fault, I should

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Have died had I not made it.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Whither bound?

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: To Milford-Haven.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: What's your name?

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Fidele, sir. I have a kinsman who

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Is bound for Italy; he embark'd at Milford;

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: To whom being going, almost spent with hunger,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I am fall'n in this offence.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Prithee, fair youth,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Think us no churls, nor measure our good minds

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: By this rude place we live in. Well encounter'd!

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: 'Tis almost night: you shall have better cheer

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Ere you depart: and thanks to stay and eat it.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Boys, bid him welcome.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Were you a woman, youth,

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: I should woo hard but be your groom. In honesty,

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: I bid for you as I'd buy.

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: I'll make't my comfort

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: He is a man; I'll love him as my brother:

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: And such a welcome as I'd give to him

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: After long absence, such is yours: most welcome!

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Be sprightly, for you fall 'mongst friends.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: 'Mongst friends,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: If brothers.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Aside

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Would it had been so, that they

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Had been my father's sons! then had my prize

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Been less, and so more equal ballasting

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: To thee, Posthumus.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: He wrings at some distress.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Would I could free't!

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Or I, whate'er it be,

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: What pain it cost, what danger. God's!

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Hark, boys.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Whispering

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Great men,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: That had a court no bigger than this cave,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: That did attend themselves and had the virtue

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Which their own conscience seal'd them--laying by

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: That nothing-gift of differing multitudes--

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Could not out-peer these twain. Pardon me, gods!

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: I'd change my sex to be companion with them,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Since Leonatus's false.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: It shall be so.

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Boys, we'll go dress our hunt. Fair youth, come in:

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: Discourse is heavy, fasting; when we have supp'd,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: We'll mannerly demand thee of thy story,

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: So far as thou wilt speak it.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Pray, draw near.

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: The night to the owl and morn to the lark

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: less welcome.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Thanks, sir.

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: I pray, draw near.

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: SCENE VII. Rome. A public place.

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Enter two Senators and Tribunes

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: This is the tenor of the emperor's writ:

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: That since the common men are now in action

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: 'Gainst the Pannonians and Dalmatians,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: And that the legions now in Gallia are

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Full weak to undertake our wars against

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: The fall'n-off Britons, that we do incite

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: The gentry to this business. He creates

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Lucius preconsul: and to you the tribunes,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: For this immediate levy, he commends

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: His absolute commission. Long live Caesar!

speaker: First Tribune
text_entry: Is Lucius general of the forces?

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: Ay.

speaker: First Tribune
text_entry: Remaining now in Gallia?

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: With those legions

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Which I have spoke of, whereunto your levy

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Must be supplyant: the words of your commission

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Will tie you to the numbers and the time

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Of their dispatch.

speaker: First Tribune
text_entry: We will discharge our duty.

speaker: First Tribune
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: First Tribune
text_entry: ACT IV

speaker: First Tribune
text_entry: SCENE I. Wales: near the cave of Belarius.

speaker: First Tribune
text_entry: Enter CLOTEN

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: I am near to the place where they should meet, if

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Pisanio have mapped it truly. How fit his garments

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: serve me! Why should his mistress, who was made by

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: him that made the tailor, not be fit too? the

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: rather--saving reverence of the word--for 'tis said

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: a woman's fitness comes by fits. Therein I must

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: play the workman. I dare speak it to myself--for it

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: is not vain-glory for a man and his glass to confer

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: in his own chamber--I mean, the lines of my body are

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: as well drawn as his; no less young, more strong,

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: not beneath him in fortunes, beyond him in the

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: advantage of the time, above him in birth, alike

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: conversant in general services, and more remarkable

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: in single oppositions: yet this imperceiverant

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: thing loves him in my despite. What mortality is!

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Posthumus, thy head, which now is growing upon thy

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: shoulders, shall within this hour be off; thy

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: mistress enforced; thy garments cut to pieces before

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: thy face: and all this done, spurn her home to her

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: father; who may haply be a little angry for my so

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: rough usage; but my mother, having power of his

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: testiness, shall turn all into my commendations. My

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: horse is tied up safe: out, sword, and to a sore

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: purpose! Fortune, put them into my hand! This is

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: the very description of their meeting-place; and

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: the fellow dares not deceive me.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Exit

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: SCENE II. Before the cave of Belarius.

speaker: CLOTEN
text_entry: Enter, from the cave, BELARIUS, GUIDERIUS, ARVIRAGUS, and IMOGEN

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: [To IMOGEN]  You are not well: remain here in the cave;

speaker: BELARIUS
text_entry: We'll come to you after hunting.

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: [To IMOGEN] Brother, stay here

speaker: ARVIRAGUS
text_entry: Are we not brothers?

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: So man and man should be;

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: But clay and clay differs in dignity,

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Whose dust is both alike. I am very sick.

speaker: GUIDERIUS
text_entry: Go you to hunting; I'll abide with him.

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: So sick I am not, yet I am not well;

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: But not so citizen a wanton as

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: To seem to die ere sick: so please you, leave me;

speaker: IMOGEN
text_entry: Stick to your journal course: the breach of custom

speaker: IMOGEN

text_entry: A Roman and a British ensign wave

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Friendly together: so through Lud's-town march:

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: And in the temple of great Jupiter

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Our peace we'll ratify; seal it with feasts.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Set on there! Never was a war did cease,

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Ere bloody hands were wash'd, with such a peace.

speaker: CYMBELINE
text_entry: Exeunt
